item.title: The Last Keyboard You Should Buy
item.description: ​ ​ Spoiler; the ridiculously good board is the HHKB2 Professional Hybrid or your pick of Happy Hacking Keyboard’s product line. If specificity in specifications or a keyboard enthusiast-esque review is more your thing, this post from Material Journal is what pushed me over the edge to cough up the somewhat aggregious amount of cash that one of these boards will run you. Something around ~$240 USD as of August of 2022.

item.title: The Real High-Fashion
item.description: ​ Trends or Fashions can be defined as waves of popularity wrt. clothing, thoughts and ways of living. At any given time the thing that is “in” is the thing that, let’s say, the “cool kids” are doing – be it bell-bottom jeans, skinny jeans, eating the rich, etc. The changes in these Fashions reflect popular culture and the generally accepted principles for which people operate within – holes in shirts = drip, if you live in 2016.

item.title: Autoencoders are Thought Translation Machines
item.description: ​ Learning is about running through data and developing a compressed representation of what you have seen in order to transform experience into knowledge that is useful in the future. If we attempt to learn things that are mundanely literal it kinda ends up being not fun — but having fun whilst learning might be the thing you exactly want to do. (see articles 1 & 2) The Godfather of Artificial Intelligence, Geoffrey Hinton is infamous for his colorful intuitions that describe phenomena in ways that just freaking click.

item.title: What is a Napkin?
item.description: Akin to the “Ponderings” page, this collection of “Napkins” is a collection of ideas that I felt were better expressed in a series of paragraphs as opposed to a question. Some of the world’s best ideas were incarnated on a napkin, these might be a few of mine. ​ The rest of this page will be a collection of examples for different features supported in the variant of markdown powering this website – pretty stuff.

item.title: Items to Ponder
item.description: I wager that when You kick the bucket, you will not be wishing you thought less critically in your life – hopefully you can critically consider a few of the following and make this ride a bit more fun: ​ How far could humanity get naming astrophysical systems/bodies with cool names like Jupiter, Andromeda, Mars, the Jovian System, Alpha Centauri, Oumuamua, or Earth as opposed to the “XP-11213- Ac#4cP” style of naming astronomical objects?
